page.title: 10Old Houses
page.content: Several old houses remain as evidence of the local history. The Plough Inn has a piece of wattle and daub wall thought to be the oldest piece of domestic architecture in the parish. Near Trysull church a Tudor style house bears an insurance company firemark. Above the Manor House door is an inscription dated 1633 saying: "Stranger should this catch your eye, do a favour passing by, bless this house ere you be gone, and it shall bless your passing on." Other dated houses are Ketley House,1707, Mill House,Seisdon,1749.The old Stone House may have been the Hundred House where justice was handed out before the Manorial Court took over. Monkspath House is built on the path monks walked between White Ladies Priory, Brewood and Dudley Priory. In Ladywell Wood are ruins of the monks resthouse.
